description: A weeknight-friendly version of the retro dinner dish, in which crispy breaded chicken and a rosy slice of ham is wrapped around an oozy cheesy center.
headline: How To Make the Easiest Chicken Cordon Bleu at Home

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container up to 4 days.Make ahead: The chicken cordon bleus can be assembled and refrigerated up to 4 hours ahead. Let sit at room temperature while the oven heats.

name: How To Make the Easiest Chicken Cordon Bleu at Home
recipeIngredient: 4 thin slices deli ham or prosciutto

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oven and prepare the baking sheet. Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 425oF. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Coat the paper of foil with cooking spray or olive oil.

Prepare the breading. Place 1 1/2 cups panko breadcrumbs in a pie plate, add 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon of the kosher salt, and toss with your fingers to combine. Beat 2 large eggs in a second shallow bowl until evenly combined. Place 1/2 cup all-purpose flour on a plate.

Pound the chicken. Pound 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts: Working with 1 chicken breast at a time, place inside a gallon zip-top bag and seal the bag, pressing out as much air as possible. Pound the breast and the tender if attached with a rolling pin, small skillet, or the flat side of a meat mallet to an even 1/4-inch thickness.

Season the chicken and brush with mustard. Season the chicken on both sides with the remaining 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. If the tenders detached from the breasts during pounding, just nestle them right next to the pounded breast. Spread 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard on the top of each piece of chicken.

Roll the chicken up with ham and cheese. Place 1 slice of ham or prosciutto on top of the mustard on each piece of chicken, then top each with 1 slice Swiss cheese, folding or arranging the ham and cheese as needed so that it doesnâ€™t extend over the chicken. Starting at a short end (pick the wider one), roll each one tightly up and arrange seam-side down.

Dredge the chicken rolls. Working with one chicken roll at a time, dredge completely in the flour, then dip into the eggs, and finally thoroughly coat with the breadcrumbs. Place on the baking sheet seam-side down.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes. Bake the chicken cordon bleus until the chicken is cooked through and registers 165oF on an instant-read thermometer, 35 to 40 minutes.
Cool 5 minutes before serving. Let the chicken cordon bleus cool 5 minutes before serving.
